p: In summer, there is an anomalous high over the high Arctic both in reanalysis (Fig. 2b) and CESM-LE (Fig. 2d). Consequently, a clockwise moisture transport is seen around the anomalous high. As a result, the zonal direction of the moisture transport over the region of 60E–120E and 70N–80N (the black longitude-latitude box in Fig. 2) is opposite to that in the spring season.
